textBox.richText: I am proud to announce AVbin 8, the first full release since 2008. To all those who pointed me in the right direction on mailing lists and forums: Thank you!!! I would like to specifically mention Alex Holkner, who created this project in the first place, and Micah Richert, whose shoulders I stood on for this release. AVbin 8 Highlights - Established which platforms were going to be supported going forward (added Win64 and OS X 64-bit Intel; dropped OS X 32-bit PPC) - Created development/build environments for each platform - Successfully compiled/released a build for each platform - Migrated from svn on Google Project to git on Github - Created a new project web site - 28 commits - Approximately 15 issues closed...though mostly since they just don’t apply any more. Known Issues with AVbin 8: - The version of FFmpeg used is one year old, and has known bugs and security problems - The AVbin binaries have not been tested internally. - The AVbin binaries have not been tested with Pyglet. - It is known that the build doesn’t actually work for a lot of file formats you would expect it to on at least one platform (win32) The previous release was based on a 3-year old FFmpeg revision. That revision had even more bugs and security problems than the newer one we used. When I took over as the new maintainer almost exactly a month ago, I accepted the generous offer of Micah Richert to use his personal build he had put together a year ago as a starting point. Since using the newest code was not a goal for this release, I simply used the exact revision that Micah used, to minimize the already considerable effort it was taking to get this project resurrected. I’ve put together a Roadmap for things to accomplish for AVbin 9. Check it out! ~ Nathan
